intro: Lappula semiglabra var. heterocaryoides, commonly known as the rough lappula, is a variant of the lappula plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lobed leaves. The flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in loose racemes, with a distinctive beak-like structure. The plant thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
